PETER: (SQUARING UP LEFT AND RIGHT, HOWLING
ALL THE TIME) Oh, please don’t make
me go on squaring at everyone like
this. Come oni

WITCH: Must be done, Peter.
PETER: But here’s the sergeant coming. Must
I square up to him? He’s six feet
high. Come on!
WITCH: Too bad, Peter - but it must be done.
SERGEANT COMES IN. PETER APPROACHES HIM,
SQUARING VIOLENTLY. KLOOQUE SHOVES HIM
CONTEMPTUOUSLY OUT OF SCENE AND APPROACHES
OLD LADY.

\l\ VcV.
KLOOQUE: Is the young man unwell?
WITCH: No, he’s quite well. He’s practicing
his boxing*
KLOOQUE: What for? ^
WITCH: He says you flirt with Pipette and
he’s going to give you a thrashing.
KLOOQUE; Ho, ho. Now, my dear little old lady,
I’m going to beg a favor of you.
WITCH: Go away, soldier. I hate soldiers!
Do you know what effect a red sash
has on me? It drives me madl
